Message:
The town was abuzz as usual.
As I passed through the square,
I found myself
stopping in my tracks.

Out of the corner of my eye,
I spotted the black robe
of an inquisitor,
with a face that looked familiar...

A chill ran down my spine.
I wanted to scream,
but I couldn’t
muster up any sound.

My heart was crying out,
and yet my body
remained still...

Maybe he thought I was suspicious
as I stood there, petrified.
Whatever the reason,
the man turned and spoke to me.

My heart nearly stopped
as our eyes met.

Of course he wouldn’t.
My parents had risked
everything to hide me...

At my reply,
the man smiled kindly.

“That’s a fine job.
Keep up the good work.”

That night, I had a dream.
A vivid recollection of what
I’d seen through the closet door.

The men in black robes.
My parents being dragged further
and further away from me.
The two of them
hung up on the gallows...

When I woke up,
only shallow breaths
escaped my throat.

Though I felt overwhelmed
with sadness, pain, and regret,
I couldn’t cry even a single tear.
